newsitem.title: FRANCE: French stocks close higher, buoyed by bonds.
newsitem.headline: French stocks close higher, buoyed by bonds.

text.p: French shares closed higher on Wednesday in robust volume, bolstered by firm bonds, strength on Wall Street and buying by U.S. investors, traders reported.
The blue-chip CAC-40 index finished up 18.63 points at 2,141.84. But the CAC-40 futures contract ended two points lower at 2,149.0.
"With 10-year interest rates at six percent, it's good for shares," one trader said, who cautioned, however, that a healthy consolidation could be in store.
Traders said that the market also benefited from asset allocation switches from Japan to Europe by U.S. investors interested in cyclical stocks, said one trader.
Another said: "Americans are starting to realise that monetary union is really going to happen" which would favour a low interest rate climate.
* Defence manufacturer Thomson CSF ended up 2.95 percent at 157.0 francs on market sentiment that Alcatel Alsthom or Lagardere could offer a relatively high price for the group.

* Castorama ends down 5.47 percent at 899 francs following meeting with analysts at which home improvements group warned it lacked foreign growth needed to compensate for regulatory curbs on domestic expansion.
* Primagaz among top gainers, soaring 9.65 percent after company posts first-half profit up 21 percent and forecasts 10 to 15 percent increase in full year profits.
* Debt-laden Anglo-French channel tunnel operator Eurotunnel SA/Plc announces deal in principle with creditors on financial restructuring.
Source close to dossier says trade in Eurotunnel shares should resume trade by Tuesday at latest. Shares were suspended at 9.05 francs on Monday.
* Holding Suez finishes up 0.73 percent at 206.50 francs in volume of 539,484 shares, swollen by block trade of 294,000 shares at 205 francs.
* Bank CIC ends 2.96 percent higher at 383.0 francs after net profit rockets 60.5 percent, beating many analysts' foreasts.
* Telecommunications giant Alcatel Alsthom ends 0.52 percent lower at 436.50 francs despite upward revisions to profit forecasts by brokerages.

* Drugs company Sanofi SOPF.PA finishes up 3.72 percent at 452.20 francs, building on Wednesday's gains after announcement it and Bristol Myers Squibb had filed regulatory applications in the United States and European Union for market approval of new hypertension drug irbesartan.
* Utility Generale des Eaux up 1.80 percent after giving analysts upbeat outlook for its new telecoms venture.
